issues.description: The solution repository defines an interface named `Dairy` instead of `Milkable`, but the problem statement and UML refer to a `Milkable` interface. As a result, students following the template/tests (which expect `Milkable`) will not find the correct type in the solution and will be blocked when trying to implement or run tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `Dairy` interface in the solution repository to `Milkable` (and update all `implements Dairy` references to `implements Milkable`) so that it matches the problem statement and template expectations.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify an interface named `Milkable`, and the templateâ€™s `Main.java` also references `Milkable`. However, the solution repository defines this interface as `Dairy` rather than `Milkable`, causing a naming mismatch for the same conceptual entity.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `Dairy` interface in the solution repository to `Milkable` (including file name and all references) so it matches the problem statement, UML, and template code.
